name: Hunger Wall Residence

reviews.text: No matter what your expectations, Hunger Wall Residence will satisfy them. My wife, toddler and I recently visited. The Hotel is completely rebuilt to the highest standards. The cafe boasts gourmet coffee and a French chef who makes the best cream of mushroom soup and hand made chocolates! The Hotel is located within the UNESCO heritage center of Prague, which was perfect for us. The staff there (Kamil and Gabriela) are committed to make sure your stay is enjoyable. These people understand service. I would not hesitate to stay for business or leisure.
reviews.title: 1st class Hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 9 nights at Hunger Wall Apartments in Prague, it was wonderful, the staff were very friendly and offered much advice. The apartment were well equipped and within wailking distance to all major tourist spots in Prague. It was a great location just across the river away from the crowd in the main city centre. It was close to many restaurants, bars and shopping centres. I could not fault these apartments and would certainly recommend them to anyione looking for excellent accommodation in Prague. The apartment were also close to subway and we travelled but public transport to and from the airport which was very cheap.
reviews.title: Wonderful Apartment

reviews.text: City centre with historic Kampa, great views from the Petrin Hill, clubs and restaurants are right at the doorstep of this hotel which I just loved. The hotel is very clean and very meticulously refurbished with attention to detail that impressed me. I will definitely request to stay in the same hotel next time I travel to Prague as this has been a great experience.
reviews.title: Very stylish hotel with full service which I enjoyed greatly.

reviews.text: We stayed at the residence for almost a week this summer. Me and my husband traveled with a 1 year old baby. The experience couldn´t have been better. The apartment is very well equipped with all the necessary. I was able to cook my baby's food since they had everything, except from a blender that I brought myself. They provided an Ikea baby's cot, much nicer that the usual travel cots. Staff was great and Gabriella provided us with all the information that we needed. She is a very kind and helpful person. They came to clean every day except Sunday. I found it great! The location was great for us. Very near to all the main areas. They also have the tram super close. I I came back to Prague I would stay in that apartment again for sure. I strongly recommend it to anybody. It is much better than an hotel.
reviews.title: Great stay, wonderful staff and apartments!

reviews.text: We just left Prague after few day stop and we would like to recommend this place to everybody. We appreciated the quality of service and rooms along with nice staff, all of this for reasonable price. The location close to the Prague Castle was also very handy.
reviews.title: Great stay in Prague on our Europe trip

reviews.text: We just returned from a 10 day trip from Prague/Vienna, and am happy to say that we had a fantastic stay at the Hungerwall Residence. We were travelling with a group of 6 adults and 2 young children, so needless to say we weren't sure how the accomodations would be for everyone, but it turned out to be great.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Hungerwall Residence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a 13 hour journey, we were thrilled at how beautiful the rooms were, and as promised we were all on the same floor (even the baby beds were made with stuffed animals included!). The cafe was a great meeting area for all of us to start our day, and we ate breakfast there almost everyday.
reviews.title: Astonishing apartment - Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is also fantastic. It's in Mala Strana, which is lesser town, and it was nice to stay in a neighborhood where you are close to sightseeing (we walked everywhere), but not an overly touristy area of town. There are also a number of great restaurants/cafes within walking distance as well.
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms, helpful staff, and fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am not sure how soon I will make it back to Prague, but if I do, I will definitely be staying here again. Thanks Kamil and all of the staff at the Hungerwall Residence.
reviews.title: Lesser Town but maximum value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This apartment wildly exceeded our expectationn. It was spotlessly clean, had a washer and dryer, large bedroom, and bathroom, as well as living room. Beautifully decorated and very comfortable. Excellent location. Usually quiet, we were there when Czech Rep. played in the hockey championships, the bar across the street was lively that evening. It was great.
reviews.title: What a find! Elegant & stylish - so much more than a hotel room - at a great price!

description: Hunger Wall is a newly opened elegant residence with complete service, ready to provide full comfort to a demanding clientele. The early 20th century (1903) building underwent a complete renovation with the preservation of elements of Secessionist architecture. A historical gem is situated in the courtyard of the building - a fragment of the Hunger Wall that was built in 1360 - 1362, during the period of the reign of Charles IV.
